column1: Abdoulaye Diallo (born 30 March 1992) is a Senegalese professional footballer who currently plays as a goalkeeper for Nottingham Forest and the Senegal national team. Born in France
column2: he is a former graduate of the prestigious Clairefontaine academy and joined Rennes in 2007. Diallo made his professional debut
column5: in a league match against Olympique Lyonnais. Diallo also represented France national youth team

column1: Diallo began his football career playing for his hometown club Stade Reims
column2: joining the club as a youth player. In 2004
column3: he was selected to attend the Clairefontaine academy and spent three years at the facility training at the academy during the weekdays and playing for Reims on the weekend. Prior to leaving Clairefontaine
column4: Diallo agreed to join the nationally recognized youth academy of Stade Rennais on an aspirant (youth) contract. Rennes had been scouting the player since 2004.

column1: Diallo joined Rennes and was among a host of internationally recognized youth talents the club had comprised. These talents included youth internationals Elliot Sorin
column4: who played for Manchester City in England
column6: and Axel Ngando. Diallo initially joined the club's under-18 team who were playing in their own league
column7: the under-18 Championnat National. Rennes finished in 4th-place position
column8: missing out on the playoffs. The 2008–09 season saw Diallo earn a place in the club's Coupe Gambardella team with the club attempting to defend their title from the previous season. In the tournament
column9: the goalkeeper appeared in three matches and conceded four goals. Rennes suffered elimination in the Round of 16 losing to Le Havre.

column1: Diallo was promoted to the club's Championnat de France amateur team for the 2009–10 season. He made his debut on 15 August 2009
column2: earning a clean sheet in the team's 2–0 victory over US Sénart-Moissy. Diallo appeared in four more matches
column3: before earning a call-up to the senior team on 20 November by manager Frédéric Antonetti for their league match against Le Mans in place of injured backup goalkeeper Cheick N'Diaye. Antonetti preferred the 17-year-old ahead of Patrice Luzi and Florent Petit
column5: respectively. Diallo appeared on the bench in the Le Mans match
column6: with Rennes earning a 2–1 victory. The following week
column7: Diallo was named the starting goalkeeper for the club's league match against Lyon
column8: almost an hour before the match was set to be played
column9: due to an injury picked up by starting goalkeeper Nicolas Douchez the previous day. Diallo started the match and played the entire 90 minutes in a 1–1 draw
column11: including an important save in the 88th minute off a shot by Bafétimbi Gomis.On 18 April 2010
column12: Diallo signed his first professional contract

column2: Diallo signed with Turkish club Gençlerbirliği.
Diallo joined EFL Championship side Nottingham Forest on 14 September 2020.
he was named in Senegal's 23-man squad for the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia. He also participated in 2017 and 2019 Africa Cup of Nations.
